chunks.title: JavaScript Functions
chunks.text: Sometimes our code gets repetitive and when the code gets repetitive, we have to package a particular code in a function.

chunks.title: JavaScript Functions
chunks.text: One more benefit of making functions in JavaScript is that you can pass arguments and get a particular work done.

chunks.title: JavaScript Functions
chunks.text: For example, printing some statements, summing numbers, taking the average of numbers,

chunks.title: JavaScript Functions
chunks.text: there are many more functions that can be made in JavaScript.

text: Sometimes our code gets repetitive and when the code gets repetitive, we have to package a particular code in a function. One more benefit of making functions in JavaScript is that you can pass arguments and get a particular work done. For example, printing some statements, summing numbers, taking the average of numbers, there are many more functions that can be made in JavaScript. What are functions? What is syntax? Why should it be used? We will understand the practical use case. So, do like this video and write Sigma Batch OP in the comment section below. Let's go to the computer screen. Let's roll the intro. So, we are going to see what is a function in JavaScript. So, in JavaScript, a function is a block of code that we use if we want to use it again and again. Let me explain what it is. So, I will make a folder named video number 58 and I will open it in my VS code. And I will show you a function directly. I will show you a function and I will say index.js. Now, let's say I tell you to print, Hey Harry, you are nice. Let's say you have to do this. Then after this, you have to do this for other people too. Or let's do one thing, Hey Harry, you are nice is written. Then you have to write, Hey Harry, you are good. And Hey Harry, your t-shirt is nice. Then I will write, Hey Harry, your course is good too. So, let's say I wrote this. Now, what I will do is, I will run it here. I have run it. So, you see what will happen here. My output will come. Hey Harry, you are nice. Hey Harry, you are good.
